instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]MBA 820 3024 battery not recognized
threads.message:
Hi,
I have a 3024 board wich was LD, it starts but the battery is not recognized.
I think is the SMC but don't have a donor board or new smc for this (have in stock only MBP 2936 SMC's)
there are other smc which are compatible with this board.

I've hoped this would not be a SMC problem so I've looked around for other clues, replaced the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and checked the <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> but all seems to be ok. 

Any thoughts on this one.

Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]MBA 820 3024 battery not recognized
threads.message: Replace SMC from donor board, no other ways around it. You can get away with swapping 11 and 13 SMCs from the same model year MBAs.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MBA 820 3024 battery not recognized
threads.message:
It works with a SMC from a 820 3023 MBA 

This was also a test for me to see how hard is to reball and change a SMC. 2-3 hours to do it but finally works  :) next one gonna be faster.

Thanks Duke. Solved
